command: $target='198.51.100.120'; $ports=@(3211,4322,5433); $delays=@(100,300,500); for($i=0;$i -lt $ports.Count;$i++){ Test-NetConnection -ComputerName $target -Port $ports[$i] -InformationLevel Quiet | Out-Null; Start-Sleep -Milliseconds $delays[$i] }; Test-NetConnection -ComputerName $target -Port 6001 -InformationLevel Detailed
explanation: Uses an inter-packet timing signature (100ms, 300ms, 500ms) as part of the knock to open TCP/6001. Detection: identify connection sequences with consistent yet unusual timing intervals; cross-reference with subsequent opening of a high port.
rationale_steps: Define a timing-based knock pattern to encode the signal.
Send TCP connect attempts with specific inter-knock delays.
Connect to the service expected to open after the timing-based signal.
Defenders: apply timing-aware analytics to detect encoded signaling sequences.
